clinical_study.brief_title: Genetic Testing of Monogenic Hypertension in Chinese Population

lead_sponsor.agency: Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences, Fuwai Hospital

clinical_study.source: Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences, Fuwai Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Monogenic hypertension, which follows the rules of Mendel's genetic law, is one of the most important causes of hypertension. Generally, patients occur hypertension in early age, have family history, and often manifest severe hypertension or refractory hypertension. At present, only a few hypertension centers of hospitals in China will help clinically difficult diagnosis hypertensive patients to test some selective genes, while most of other hospitals still perform diagnosis based on biochemical examination and clinical symptoms. Therefore, in order to provide better guidance for the diagnosis and treatment for hypertensive patients, this project aims to develop a single gene detection panel for genetic hypertension, so as to provide new diagnostic technology for early intervention, prevention and treatment of hypertension in clinics.

primary_outcome.measure: number of genetic variants in Monogenic Hypertension patients as assessed by specific gene panel

study_pop.textblock: High blood pressure outpatients and inpatients from national multi-hypertension center.
